item.title: The Strokes Is This It at 20: Nudes, booze and 9/11
item.description: How the New York City band's 2001 debut album heralded "a new spirit in guitar music".

item.title: Scarlett Johansson sues Disney over streaming of Black Widow
item.description: The star says box office takings for Black Widow were hit when it was streamed at the same time.

item.title: Nightclubs start asking for NHS Covid pass in England
item.description: It comes as the Lib Dems demand MPs debate their use in England amid concerns over discrimination.

item.title: The Suicide Squad: Positive reviews for 'riotous' film
item.description: Critics largely embrace the film, with most saying it is "slicker and funnier" than the 2016 movie.

item.title: Doctor Who: Jodie Whittaker and Chris Chibnall to leave in 2022
item.description: The star of the BBC sci-fi drama series will bow out with a trio of specials.

item.title: X Factor: ITV has no plans for another series of the show
item.description: The fat lady may be singing for Simon Cowell's long-running but currently dormant TV talent show.

item.title: Older Kindles may lose internet connection, Amazon warns
item.description: Amazon tells customers older Kindles might lose their ability to connect online.

item.title: Johnny Ventura: Dominican merengue legend dies aged 81
item.description: The Dominican Republic singer, whose career spanned six decades, is seen as a Latin music legend.

item.title: Rare Harry Potter book sells for Â£80k at Leyburn auction
item.description: The volume sold at auction in North Yorkshire for almost three times its estimated price.

item.title: Marilyn Manson files to dismiss Esme Bianco's sex assault case
item.description: The rock star says claims by Game of Thrones actress Esme Bianco are part of a "coordinated attack".

item.title: Bob Odenkirk: Better Call Saul actor 'stable' after 'heart-related incident' during filming
item.description: The US actor is still in hospital after being rushed there from the set of Better Call Saul.

item.title: Netflix US cast and crew must be vaccinated to work
item.description: The online streaming firm is the latest company to make Covid jabs mandatory for workers.

item.title: Dusty Hill: ZZ Top bassist dies aged 72
item.description: Dusty Hill played bass for the iconic US blues rock band for more than five decades.

item.title: Fake or Fortune?: 'Henry Moore sculpture' mystery solved by TV show
item.description: Experts give their verdict on a piece thought to be the work of the acclaimed artist.

item.title: H.E.R. on shedding her anonymity and conquering R&B
item.description: For years the singer stayed in the shadows but after Grammy and Oscar wins she's ready to be seen.

item.title: Knitting photo wins Wellcome Photography Prize
item.description: A gallery of some of the winning pictures from this year's Wellcome Photography Prize.

item.title: Latitude festival: Magical, emotional... and a little bit frightening
item.description: Bands and fans describe the atmosphere at the UK's first full-capacity festival since 2019.

item.title: Amy Winehouse: Could there be new music on the way?
item.description: Ten years after her death, Amy's parents say they want fans to hear CDs of her unreleased material.

item.title: Anne-Marie: I've always loved the idea of revenge
item.description: The pop star on beating anxiety, growing bored of her biggest song, and her revenge fantasies.

item.title: Benin Bronzes: Nigeria dispute jeopardises return of artefacts
item.description: Several museums in Europe have talked of returning the looted artefacts - but where will they be housed in Nigeria?

item.title: Halima Aden and Tommy Hilfiger: âItâs not just about diverse catwalksâ
item.description: The worldâs first hijab-wearing supermodel talks to fashion designer Tommy Hilfiger about why she quit the industry.

item.title: Latitude 2021: What being a Covid test event means for the festival
item.description: The festival in Suffolk will be the first major event following the lifting of most restrictions.

item.title: Rapper ENNY talks sexual consent in latest track
item.description: The rising south London rapper talks about art imitating life in her new single.

item.title: Marble Arch Mound: 'I wouldn't pay Â£4 to walk up a hill'
item.description: The public reacts to London's newest tourist attraction, which is facing complaints of being incomplete.

item.title: Archibald Prize: 100 years of Australia's top portrait honour
item.description: Over 100 years, the Archibald Prize has become better at reflecting Australian diversity.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: From lockdown animations to Snoop Dogg music video
item.description: After his homemade animations went viral, Snoop Dogg asked Peter Quinn to direct his new video.

item.title: 10 years on: Amy's parents on new documentary
item.description: The late singer's father says he hopes a new documentary will show a "more rounded image" of Amy.
